title: Sharon Osbourne could be OUT of the X Factor after she's struck down by shock health crisis
text:
Showbiz Sharon Osbourne could be OUT of the X Factor after she's struck down by shock health crisis The show judge is in agony from a trapped nerve and she may have to have back surgery to ease the pain Share Sharon had to take most of last week off her US TV show (Photo: Getty)   
Sharon Osbourne ’s future on the X Factor could be in trouble due to a health crisis. 
The show’s judge has revealed she is suffering from immense pain from a trapped nerve, which may mean restorative back surgery. 
The recovery time could jeopardise her appearances at the auditions in the summer and potentially her plane travel to and from Los Angeles and London. 
Sharon spoke about her spinal nightmare, which was so severe she had to take off most of last week’s recordings of her US TV show The Talk. 
Spinal surgeries are incredibly tricky and may mean patients enduring several procedures and even flight bans due to airplane pressure impacting the spine and nerves. 
Sharon has admitted that she has had an epidural, but is in pain. Doctors have told her to wait a week to see if the spinal injection will reduce the swelling and pain. Sharon says she has had an epidural but is still in pain (Photo: Getty) 
Speaking in the US Sharon said: “Right now I happen to have trapped nerve in my back and it’s killing me. 
“I have a trapped nerve...a pinch between my L3 and L4 and I had to have, what is it when you have a baby, an epidural. There was no baby, but I had an epidural and I woke up to no baby, just a bad back. 
“Anyway, um yes. That’s why I wasn’t in last week. “ 
Reflecting on her recovery, she admitted: “I wait another week and if it hasn’t fixed it then I have to have surgery.” 
Sharon, 64, admitted she is undergoing daily physical therapy sessions to try and rectify her problems. 
She says that she has no idea how the pain really started: “I just bent down “I bent down picking something up. Nothing, nothing, nothing and it was like ‘oh that was a bit rough’ when I came back up and I didn’t think anything of it. 
“A couple of hours later it was like a stabbbing pain.” 
Sharon is renown for her medical woes. The TV star with her fellow panelists on The Talk (Photo: WireImage) 
She also has confessed that she was once plagued by “insane” temper tantrums - but those have been quashed by drugs. 
Sharon felt was she was now much better at “controlling my initial reactions to things.” 
“This is so much better than it used to be-so much better. 
“I used to just blow a gasket. I was completely insane. And especially if there was an emergency I would be the one screaming and waving arms in the air. 
“It was really like pressure and stress the whole time. 
“Now it has just gone way down.” 
Asked what has helped the change, she replied: “I think different medication.” 
In 2015 Sharon revealed that she took a month off work after she “had gone crazy for a while”. 
The famous TV star was struck down by a debilitating bout of depression. Sharon and Ozzy with one of their pooches (Photo: Getty) 
She admitted she had to “unplug from society” as she sank into a dark place. 
Sharon confessed that it took four weeks for specialists to pinpoint a medication to ease her suffering , which she described as being removed from a “padded cell.” 
She added: “I needed to unplug from society.” 
And after experimenting with several cocktails of anti-depression medication, she felt ready to “take me out of the padded cell and put me back on The Talk.” 
Asked about her absence Sharon explained: “That was my head. I had gone a bit crazy for a while. I suffer with really bad depression from time to time . 
“It is heinous, you know that.” The TV star says she suffered depression for years (Photo: Getty) 
Doctors then worked with with mental health specialists to find medication to steady her mental troubles She added: “I couldn’t get on a medication that could help so it was all these trial and errors. it is awful to be put on medication that somehow sends your body crazy and your head crazier than it already is and then it is like argh!. 
“I tried loads of medications. “I probably tried four or five different until I found one that suited my chemistry and now I am back today.” 
In 2014 Sharon opened up that she has been “popping pills for 16 years” to cope with depression. 
And the TV star insists “she couldn’t live without” that medication to keep her mind sane and balanced. Sharon insisted that she had not disclosed her battle for a long time publicly as she has much self-doubt. Like us on Facebook
